column4: I've actually come to like Unity. Took a bit, but it's kind of nice.
Well, it's pretty much replaced Gnome-Do for me. I very very very rarely actually click anything if I can avoid it
I never used Gnome-Do, because it was a toy
Have you given 11.10 a try? I don't know if it would be any better
can you not install it? or maybe go with something like lxde and customize?
that is one thing i miss about gnome-do. i liked being able to launch apps and run commands from the same box
I still do most of my installing with apt-get. Software center usually just for searching for something I don't know of yet
I'm sure someone will quickly build a gnome 2/3 package that gets you to a more traditional desktop
I don't really know of any full fledged desktop environments other than those. But there are a ton of window managers
You could try customizing an environment. LXDE is pretty easy
I like LXDE, but last time I tried, it didn't work too well with my regular plugging and unplugging of external monitors
That makes sense. A lot. They're still a little behind
It probably wouldn't be too terribly hard to replace unity with gnome. From what I understand Unity is actually just kind of sitting on top of gnome. I think. Not really sure
Yes, and for 11.04 that was sort of valid, because it was Gnome 2
Have you given Linux Mint a try? I haven't heard much out of them recently, but if they're still around you might really like it
They're built on Ubuntu last I knew, but use their own panels and stuff. You might hate it, you might love it.
